meanings.definition: Having a leaner or more slender build than average.
meanings.sent1: The cat was rangier than the other cats in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the rangier models of cars because they were easier to park.
meanings.sent3: The rangier tree in the forest always seemed to be showing off its slim branches.
meanings.sent4: His rangier frame allowed him to squeeze through the narrow gap in the fence.
meanings.sent5: The rangier figure of the dancer glided gracefully across the stage.

meanings.definition: Comparatively more rangy in size or shape.
meanings.sent1: The rangier branches of the tree reached out further than the others.
meanings.sent2: The rangier hills in the distance looked like giant waves frozen in time.
meanings.sent3: The rangier balloon in the parade seemed to be trying to escape into the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her rangier scarf billowed in the wind as she walked along the beach.
meanings.sent5: The rangier clouds in the sky cast long shadows over the landscape.
